Key Arguments: The bill's definition of misinformation is subjective and grants the government arbitrary power.
The legislation gives ACMA draconian powers to silence government critics, creating a chilling effect on free expression.
The bill protects government and mainstream media, creating an imbalance in the treatment of different voices.
The bill could lead to suppression of legitimate criticisms and open dialogue on various issues.
Notable Quotes: I STRONGLY believe that FREEDOM OF SPEECH is an essential human right and a fundamental principle of Australian democracy.
Essentially, this Bill means that, 'misinformation' or 'disinformation', can mean anything the government wants it to mean.
Government and Health departments and their experts are often wrong and with dire or even fatal consequences for many people and businesses.
